title: 1992년 United States v. Gerald Harris 사건
summary: 미국 USA, Federal 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: United States v. Gerald Harris. 판결일: 1992-05-27. 법원: Court of Appeals for the First Circuit.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: UNITED STATES, Appellee, v. Gerald HARRIS, Defendant, Appellant
**판결일**: 1992-05-27
**법원**: Court of Appeals for the First Circuit
**관할**: USA, Federal

**판사**: Breyer, Coffin, Cyr

## 변호인

David A. Schechter, by appointment of the Court, with whom Law Offices of David A. Schechter, Providence, R.I., was on brief, for defendant, appellant., Margaret E. Curran, Asst. U.S. Atty., with whom Lincoln C. Almond, U.S. Atty., and Edward J. Gale, Asst. U.S. Atty., Providence, R.I., were on brief for appellee.

## 인용

- 964 F.2d 1234

## 판결문 요약

964 F.2d 1234
    UNITED STATES, Appellee,v.Gerald HARRIS, Defendant, Appellant.
    No. 91-1342.
    United States Court of Appeals,First Circuit.
    Heard April 7, 1992.Decided May 27, 1992.
    
      David A. Schechter, by appointment of the Court, with whom Law Offices of David A. Schechter, Providence, R.I., was on brief, for defendant, appellant.
      Margaret E. Curran, Asst. U.S. Atty., with whom Lincoln C. Almond, U.S. Atty., and Edward J. Gale, Asst. U.S. Atty., Providence, R.I., were on brief for appellee.
      Before BREYER, Chief Judge, COFFIN, Senior Circuit Judge, and CYR, Circuit Judge.
      BREYER, Chief Judge.
    
    
      1
      Gerald Harris has been convicted of being a felon in possession of a firearm, 18 U.S.C. § 922(g)(1).   He appeals the fifteen-year sentence that a sentence-enhancement statute requires the district court to impose when a gun-possessing felon "has three previous convictions ... for violent felon[ies]."  18 U.S.C. § 924(e)(1).   He claims that the court should not have counted as "violent felonies," two of his previous Massachusetts convictions for "assault and battery."   Harris makes two arguments, neither of which warrants resentencing.
    
    
      2
      * The Supreme Court has held that, in determining whether a prior offense is a "violent felony" for sentence-enhancement purposes, the sentencing court should "look only to the fact of conviction and the statutory definition of the prior offense."  Taylor v...
